data.name: سُورَةُ صٓ
data.englishBism: In the name of God, The Most Gracious, The Dispenser of Grace

ayahs.englishText: Sad. CONSIDER this Qur’an, endowed with all that one ought to remember!
ayahs.arabicText: ص ۚ وَالْقُرْآنِ ذِي الذِّكْرِ

ayahs.englishText: But nay - they who are bent on denying the truth are lost in [false] pride, and [hence] deeply in the wrong.
ayahs.arabicText: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي عِزَّةٍ وَشِقَاقٍ

ayahs.englishText: How many a generation have We destroyed before their time [for this very sin]! And [how] they called [unto Us] when it was too late to escape!
ayahs.arabicText: كَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ مِنْ قَرْنٍ فَنَادَوْا وَلَاتَ حِينَ مَنَاصٍ

ayahs.englishText: Now these [people] deem it strange that a warner should have come unto them from their own midst - and [so] the deniers of the truth are saying: “A [mere] spellbinder is he, a liar!
ayahs.arabicText: وَعَجِبُوا أَنْ جَاءَهُمْ مُنْذِرٌ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَقَالَ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا سَاحِرٌ كَذَّابٌ

ayahs.englishText: Does he claim that all the deities are [but] one God? Verily, a most strange thing is this!”
ayahs.arabicText: أَجَعَلَ الْآلِهَةَ إِلَٰهًا وَاحِدًا ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيْءٌ عُجَابٌ

ayahs.englishText: And their leaders launch forth [thus]: “Go ahead, and hold steadfastly onto your deities: this, behold, is the only thing to do!
ayahs.arabicText: وَانْطَلَقَ الْمَلَأُ مِنْهُمْ أَنِ امْشُوا وَاصْبِرُوا عَلَىٰ آلِهَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيْءٌ يُرَادُ

ayahs.englishText: Never did we hear of [a claim like] this in any faith of latter days! It is nothing but [a mortal man’s] invention!
ayahs.arabicText: مَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَٰذَا فِي الْمِلَّةِ الْآخِرَةِ إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا اخْتِلَاقٌ

ayahs.englishText: What! Upon him alone from among all of us should a [divine] reminder have been bestowed from on high?” Nay, but it is My Own reminder that they distrust! Nay, they have not yet tasted the suffering which I do impose!
ayahs.arabicText: أَأُنْزِلَ عَلَيْهِ الذِّكْرُ مِنْ بَيْنِنَا ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي شَكٍّ مِنْ ذِكْرِي ۖ بَلْ لَمَّا يَذُوقُوا عَذَابِ

ayahs.englishText: Or do they [think that they] own the treasures of thy Sustainer’s grace - [the grace] of the Almighty, the Giver of Gifts?
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَحْمَةِ رَبِّكَ الْعَزِيزِ الْوَهَّابِ

ayahs.englishText: Or [that] the dominion over the heavens and the earth and all that is between them is theirs? Why, then, let them try to ascend [to God-like power] by all [conceivable] means!
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ لَهُمْ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ فَلْيَرْتَقُوا فِي الْأَسْبَابِ

ayahs.englishText: [But] there it is: any and all human beings, however [strongly] leagued together, are bound to suffer defeat [whenever they refuse to accept the truth].
ayahs.arabicText: جُنْدٌ مَا هُنَالِكَ مَهْزُومٌ مِنَ الْأَحْزَابِ

ayahs.englishText: To the truth gave the lie aforetime Noah’s people, and [the tribe of] Ad, and Pharaoh of the [many] tent-poles,
ayahs.arabicText: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ ذُو الْأَوْتَادِ

ayahs.englishText: and [the tribe of] Thamud, and the people of Lot, and the dwellers of the wooded dales [of Madyan]: they all were leagued together, [as it were, in their unbelief:]
ayahs.arabicText: وَثَمُودُ وَقَوْمُ لُوطٍ وَأَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ الْأَحْزَابُ

ayahs.englishText: not one [was there] but gave the lie to the apostles - and thereupon My retribution fell due.
ayahs.arabicText: إِنْ كُلٌّ إِلَّا كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقَابِ

ayahs.englishText: And they [who now deny the truth - they, too,] have but to wait for one single blast [of punishment to overtake them]: it shall not be delayed a whit.
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا يَنْظُرُ هَٰؤُلَاءِ إِلَّا صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً مَا لَهَا مِنْ فَوَاقٍ

ayahs.englishText: As it is, they say [mockingly]: “O our Sus­tainer! Hasten on to us our share [of punishment even] before the Day of Reckoning!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَقَالُوا رَبَّنَا عَجِّلْ لَنَا قِطَّنَا قَبْلَ يَوْمِ الْحِسَابِ

ayahs.englishText: [But] bear thou with patience whatever they may say, and remember Our servant David, him who was endowed with [so much] inner strength! He, verily, would always turn unto Us:
ayahs.arabicText: اصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا دَاوُودَ ذَا الْأَيْدِ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ

ayahs.englishText: [and for this,] behold, We caused the mountains to join him in extolling Our limitless glory at eventide and at sun­rise,
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا سَخَّرْنَا الْجِبَالَ مَعَهُ يُسَبِّحْنَ بِالْعَشِيِّ وَالْإِشْرَاقِ

ayahs.englishText: and [likewise] the birds in their assemblies: [together] they all Would turn again and again unto Him [who had created them].
ayahs.arabicText: وَالطَّيْرَ مَحْشُورَةً ۖ كُلٌّ لَهُ أَوَّابٌ

ayahs.englishText: And We streng­thened his dominion, and bestowed upon him wisdom and sagacity in judgment.
ayahs.arabicText: وَشَدَدْنَا مُلْكَهُ وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْحِكْمَةَ وَفَصْلَ الْخِطَابِ

ayahs.englishText: AND YET, has the story of the litigants come within thy ken - [the story of the two] who surmounted the walls of the sanctuary [in which David prayed]?
ayahs.arabicText: ۞ وَهَلْ أَتَاكَ نَبَأُ الْخَصْمِ إِذْ تَسَوَّرُوا الْمِحْرَابَ

ayahs.englishText: As they came upon David, and he shrank back in fear from them, they said: “Fear not! [We are but] two litigants. One of us has wronged the other: so judge thou between us with justice, and deviate not from what is right, and show [both of] us the way to rectitude.
ayahs.arabicText: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَىٰ دَاوُودَ فَفَزِعَ مِنْهُمْ ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ خَصْمَانِ بَغَىٰ بَعْضُنَا عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فَاحْكُمْ بَيْنَنَا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا تُشْطِطْ وَاهْدِنَا إِلَىٰ سَوَاءِ الصِّرَاطِ

ayahs.englishText: “Behold, this is my brother: he has ninety-nine ewes, whereas I have [only] one ewe - and yet he said, ‘Make her over to me,’ and forcibly prevailed against me in this [our] dispute.”
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ هَٰذَا أَخِي لَهُ تِسْعٌ وَتِسْعُونَ نَعْجَةً وَلِيَ نَعْجَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ فَقَالَ أَكْفِلْنِيهَا وَعَزَّنِي فِي الْخِطَابِ

ayahs.englishText: Said [David]: “He has certainly wronged thee by demanding that thy ewe be added to his ewes! Thus, behold, do many kinsmen wrong one another [all] save those who believe [in God] and do righteous deeds: but how few are they!” And [suddenly] David understood that We had tried him: and so he asked his Sustainer to forgive him his sin, and fell down in prostration, and turned unto Him in repentance.
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ لَقَدْ ظَلَمَكَ بِسُؤَالِ نَعْجَتِكَ إِلَىٰ نِعَاجِهِ ۖ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِنَ الْخُلَطَاءِ لَيَبْغِي بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَقَلِيلٌ مَا هُمْ ۗ وَظَنَّ دَاوُودُ أَنَّمَا فَتَنَّاهُ فَاسْتَغْفَرَ رَبَّهُ وَخَرَّ رَاكِعًا وَأَنَابَ ۩

ayahs.englishText: And thereupon We forgave him that [sin]: and, verily, nearness to Us awaits him [in the life to come], and the most beauteous of all goals!
ayahs.arabicText: فَغَفَرْنَا لَهُ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِنْدَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ

ayahs.englishText: [And We said:] “O David! Behold, We have made thee a [prophet and, thus, Our] vicegerent on earth: judge, then, between men with justice, and do not follow vain desire, lest it lead thee astray from the path of God: verily, for those who go astray from the path of God there is suffering severe in store for having forgotten the Day of Reckoning!”
ayahs.arabicText: يَا دَاوُودُ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَاكَ خَلِيفَةً فِي الْأَرْضِ فَاحْكُمْ بَيْنَ النَّاسِ بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا تَتَّبِعِ الْهَوَىٰ فَيُضِلَّكَ عَنْ سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَضِلُّونَ عَنْ سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ بِمَا نَسُوا يَوْمَ الْحِسَابِ

ayahs.englishText: AND [thus it is:] We have not created heaven and earth and all that is between them without meaning and purpose, as is the surmise of those who are bent on denying the truth: but then, woe from the fire [of hell] unto all who are bent on denying the truth!
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاءَ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا بَاطِلًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ظَنُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا ۚ فَوَيْلٌ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنَ النَّارِ

ayahs.englishText: [For,] would We treat those who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds in the same manner as [We shall treat] those who spread corruption on earth? Would We treat the God-conscious in the same manner as the wicked?
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْ نَجْعَلُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ كَالْمُفْسِدِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ نَجْعَلُ الْمُتَّقِينَ كَالْفُجَّارِ

ayahs.englishText: [All this have We expounded in this] blessed divine writ which We have revealed unto thee, [O Muhammad,] so that men may ponder over its mes­sages, and that those who are endowed with insight may take them to heart.
ayahs.arabicText: كِتَابٌ أَنْزَلْنَاهُ إِلَيْكَ مُبَارَكٌ لِيَدَّبَّرُوا آيَاتِهِ وَلِيَتَذَكَّرَ أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ

ayahs.englishText: AND UNTO DAVID We granted Solomon [as a son - and] how excellent a servant [of Ours he grew up to be]! Behold, he would always turn unto Us -
ayahs.arabicText: وَوَهَبْنَا لِدَاوُودَ سُلَيْمَانَ ۚ نِعْمَ الْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ

ayahs.englishText: [and even] when, towards the close of day, nobly-bred, swift-footed steeds were brought before him,
ayahs.arabicText: إِذْ عُرِضَ عَلَيْهِ بِالْعَشِيِّ الصَّافِنَاتُ الْجِيَادُ

ayahs.englishText: he would say, “Verily, I have come to love the love of all that is good because I bear my Sustainer in mind!” [repeating these words as the steeds raced away,] until they were hidden by the veil [of distance - whereupon he would command],
ayahs.arabicText: فَقَالَ إِنِّي أَحْبَبْتُ حُبَّ الْخَيْرِ عَنْ ذِكْرِ رَبِّي حَتَّىٰ تَوَارَتْ بِالْحِجَابِ

ayahs.englishText: “Bring them back unto me!”- and would [lovingly] stroke their legs and their necks.
ayahs.arabicText: رُدُّوهَا عَلَيَّ ۖ فَطَفِقَ مَسْحًا بِالسُّوقِ وَالْأَعْنَاقِ

ayahs.englishText: But [ere this], indeed, We had tried Solomon by placing upon his throne a [lifeless] body; and thereupon he turned [towards Us; and]
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا سُلَيْمَانَ وَأَلْقَيْنَا عَلَىٰ كُرْسِيِّهِ جَسَدًا ثُمَّ أَنَابَ

ayahs.englishText: he prayed: “O my Sustainer! Forgive me my sins, and bestow upon me the gift of a kingdom which may not suit anyone after me: verily, Thou alone art a giver of gifts!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَهَبْ لِي مُلْكًا لَا يَنْبَغِي لِأَحَدٍ مِنْ بَعْدِي ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْوَهَّابُ

ayahs.englishText: And so We made subservient to him the wind, so that it gently sped at his behest whithersoever he willed,
ayahs.arabicText: فَسَخَّرْنَا لَهُ الرِّيحَ تَجْرِي بِأَمْرِهِ رُخَاءً حَيْثُ أَصَابَ

ayahs.englishText: as well as all the rebellious forces [that We made to work for him] - every kind of builder and diver -
ayahs.arabicText: وَالشَّيَاطِينَ كُلَّ بَنَّاءٍ وَغَوَّاصٍ

ayahs.englishText: and others linked together in fetters.
ayahs.arabicText: وَآخَرِينَ مُقَرَّنِينَ فِي الْأَصْفَادِ

ayahs.englishText: [And We told him:] “This is Our gift, for thee to bestow freely on others, or to withhold, without [having to render] account!”
ayahs.arabicText: هَٰذَا عَطَاؤُنَا فَامْنُنْ أَوْ أَمْسِكْ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ

ayahs.englishText: And, verily, nearness to Us awaits him [in the life to come], and the most beauteous of all goals!
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّ لَهُ عِنْدَنَا لَزُلْفَىٰ وَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ

ayahs.englishText: AND CALL to mind Our servant Job, [how it was] when he cried out to his Sustainer, “Behold, Satan has afflicted me with [utter] weariness and suffering!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَاذْكُرْ عَبْدَنَا أَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ الشَّيْطَانُ بِنُصْبٍ وَعَذَابٍ

ayahs.englishText: [and thereupon was told:] “Strike [the ground] with thy foot: here is cool water to wash with and to drink!”
ayahs.arabicText: ارْكُضْ بِرِجْلِكَ ۖ هَٰذَا مُغْتَسَلٌ بَارِدٌ وَشَرَابٌ

ayahs.englishText: And We bestowed upon him new offspring, doubling their number as an act of grace from Us, and as a reminder unto all who are endowed with insight.
ayahs.arabicText: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُ أَهْلَهُ وَمِثْلَهُمْ مَعَهُمْ رَحْمَةً مِنَّا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِأُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ

ayahs.englishText: [And finally We told him:] “Now take in thy hand a small bunch of grass, and strike therewith, and thou wilt not break thine oath!” for, verily, We found him full of patience in adversity: how excellent a servant [of Ours], who, behold, would always turn unto Us!
ayahs.arabicText: وَخُذْ بِيَدِكَ ضِغْثًا فَاضْرِبْ بِهِ وَلَا تَحْنَثْ ۗ إِنَّا وَجَدْنَاهُ صَابِرًا ۚ نِعْمَ الْعَبْدُ ۖ إِنَّهُ أَوَّابٌ

ayahs.englishText: AND CALL to mind Our servants Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, [all of them] endowed with inner strength and vision:
ayahs.arabicText: وَاذْكُرْ عِبَادَنَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ أُولِي الْأَيْدِي وَالْأَبْصَارِ

ayahs.englishText: for, verily, We purified them by means of a thought most pure: the remembrance of the life to come.
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا أَخْلَصْنَاهُمْ بِخَالِصَةٍ ذِكْرَى الدَّارِ

ayahs.englishText: And, behold, in Our sight they were indeed among the elect, the truly good!
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّهُمْ عِنْدَنَا لَمِنَ الْمُصْطَفَيْنَ الْأَخْيَارِ

ayahs.englishText: And call to mind Ishmael and Elisha, and every one who [like them] has pledged himself [unto Us]: for, each of them was of the truly good!
ayahs.arabicText: وَاذْكُرْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ وَالْيَسَعَ وَذَا الْكِفْلِ ۖ وَكُلٌّ مِنَ الْأَخْيَارِ

ayahs.englishText: LET [all] this be a reminder [to those who believe in God] - for, verily, the most beauteous of all goals awaits the God-conscious:
ayahs.arabicText: هَٰذَا ذِكْرٌ ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ لَحُسْنَ مَآبٍ

ayahs.englishText: gardens of perpetual bliss, with gates wide-open to them,
ayahs.arabicText: جَنَّاتِ عَدْنٍ مُفَتَّحَةً لَهُمُ الْأَبْوَابُ

ayahs.englishText: wherein they will recline, [and] wherein they may [freely] call for many a fruit and drink,
ayahs.arabicText: مُتَّكِئِينَ فِيهَا يَدْعُونَ فِيهَا بِفَاكِهَةٍ كَثِيرَةٍ وَشَرَابٍ

ayahs.englishText: having beside them well-matched mates of modest gaze.”
ayahs.arabicText: ۞ وَعِنْدَهُمْ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ أَتْرَابٌ

ayahs.englishText: This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning:
ayahs.arabicText: هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِيَوْمِ الْحِسَابِ

ayahs.englishText: this, verily, shall be Our provision [for you], with no end to it!
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَرِزْقُنَا مَا لَهُ مِنْ نَفَادٍ

ayahs.englishText: All this [for the righteous]: but, verily, the most evil of all goals awaits those who are wont to transgress the bounds of what is right:
ayahs.arabicText: هَٰذَا ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلطَّاغِينَ لَشَرَّ مَآبٍ

ayahs.englishText: hell will they have to endure - and how vile a resting-place!
ayahs.arabicText: جَهَنَّمَ يَصْلَوْنَهَا فَبِئْسَ الْمِهَادُ

ayahs.englishText: This, [then, for them -] so let them taste it: burning despair and ice-cold darkness
ayahs.arabicText: هَٰذَا فَلْيَذُوقُوهُ حَمِيمٌ وَغَسَّاقٌ

ayahs.englishText: and, coupled with it, further [suffering] of a similar nature.
ayahs.arabicText: وَآخَرُ مِنْ شَكْلِهِ أَزْوَاجٌ

ayahs.englishText: [And they will say to one another: “Do you see] this crowd of people who rushed headlong [into sin] with you? No welcome to them! Verily, they [too] shall have to endure the fire!”
ayahs.arabicText: هَٰذَا فَوْجٌ مُقْتَحِمٌ مَعَكُمْ ۖ لَا مَرْحَبًا بِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ صَالُو النَّارِ

ayahs.englishText: [And] they [who had been seduced] will exclaim: “Nay, but it is you! No welcome to you! It is you who have prepared this for us: and how vile a state to abide in!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا بَلْ أَنْتُمْ لَا مَرْحَبًا بِكُمْ ۖ أَنْتُمْ قَدَّمْتُمُوهُ لَنَا ۖ فَبِئْسَ الْقَرَارُ

ayahs.englishText: [And] they will pray: “O our Sustainer! Who­ever has prepared this for us, double Thou his suffering in the fire!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالُوا رَبَّنَا مَنْ قَدَّمَ لَنَا هَٰذَا فَزِدْهُ عَذَابًا ضِعْفًا فِي النَّارِ

ayahs.englishText: And they will add: “How is it that we do not see [here any of the] men whom we were wont to count among the wicked,
ayahs.arabicText: وَقَالُوا مَا لَنَا لَا نَرَىٰ رِجَالًا كُنَّا نَعُدُّهُمْ مِنَ الْأَشْرَارِ

ayahs.englishText: [and] whom we made the target of our derision? Or is it that [they are here, and] our eyes have missed them?”
ayahs.arabicText: أَتَّخَذْنَاهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا أَمْ زَاغَتْ عَنْهُمُ الْأَبْصَارُ

ayahs.englishText: Such, behold, will in truth be the [confusion and] mutual wrangling of the people of the fire!
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ لَحَقٌّ تَخَاصُمُ أَهْلِ النَّارِ

ayahs.englishText: SAY [O Muhammad]: “I am only a warner; and there is no deity whatever save God, the One, who holds absolute sway over all that exists,
ayahs.arabicText: قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَنَا مُنْذِرٌ ۖ وَمَا مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ إِلَّا اللَّهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ

ayahs.englishText: the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Almighty, the All-Forgiving!”
ayahs.arabicText: رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفَّارُ

ayahs.englishText: Say: “This is a message tremendous:
ayahs.arabicText: قُلْ هُوَ نَبَأٌ عَظِيمٌ

ayahs.englishText: [how can] you turn away from it?”
ayahs.arabicText: أَنْتُمْ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [Say, O Muhammad:] “No knowledge would I have had of [what passed among] the host on high when they argued [against the creation of man],
ayahs.arabicText: مَا كَانَ لِيَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ بِالْمَلَإِ الْأَعْلَىٰ إِذْ يَخْتَصِمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: had it not been revealed unto me [by God] - to no other end than that I might convey [unto you] a plain warning.
ayahs.arabicText: إِنْ يُوحَىٰ إِلَيَّ إِلَّا أَنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ

ayahs.englishText: [For,] lo, thy Sustainer said unto the angels: “Behold, I am about to create a human being out of clay;
ayahs.arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ إِنِّي خَالِقٌ بَشَرًا مِنْ طِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: and when I have formed him fully and breathed into him of My spirit, fall you down before him in prostration!”
ayahs.arabicText: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِنْ رُوحِي فَقَعُوا لَهُ سَاجِدِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Thereupon the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together,
ayahs.arabicText: فَسَجَدَ الْمَلَائِكَةُ كُلُّهُمْ أَجْمَعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: save Iblis: he gloried in his arrogance, and [thus] became one of those who deny the truth.
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ اسْتَكْبَرَ وَكَانَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Said He: “O Iblis! What has kept thee from prostrating thyself before that [being] which I have created with My hands? Art thou too proud [to bow down before another created being], or art thou of those who think [only] of themselves as high?”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ يَا إِبْلِيسُ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَنْ تَسْجُدَ لِمَا خَلَقْتُ بِيَدَيَّ ۖ أَسْتَكْبَرْتَ أَمْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الْعَالِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Answered [Iblis]: “I am better than he: Thou hast created me out of fire, whereas him Thou hast created out of clay.”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ أَنَا خَيْرٌ مِنْهُ ۖ خَلَقْتَنِي مِنْ نَارٍ وَخَلَقْتَهُ مِنْ طِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: Said He: “Go forth, then, from this [angelic state] - for, behold, thou art henceforth accursed,
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ فَاخْرُجْ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٌ

ayahs.englishText: and My rejection shall be thy due until the Day of Judgment!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ لَعْنَتِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ

ayahs.englishText: Said [Iblis]: “Then, O my Sustainer, grant me a respite till the Day when all shall be raised from the dead!”
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنْظِرْنِي إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ

ayahs.englishText: Answered He: “Verily, so [be it:] thou shalt be among those who are granted respite
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ الْمُنْظَرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: till the Day the time whereof is known [only to Me].”
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْوَقْتِ الْمَعْلُومِ

ayahs.englishText: [Whereupon Iblis] said: “Then [I swear] by Thy very might: I shall most certainly beguile them all into grievous error –
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ فَبِعِزَّتِكَ لَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [all] save such of them as are truly Thy servants!”
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنْهُمُ الْمُخْلَصِينَ

ayahs.englishText: [And God] said: “This, then, is the truth! And this truth do I state:
ayahs.arabicText: قَالَ فَالْحَقُّ وَالْحَقَّ أَقُولُ

ayahs.englishText: Most certainly will I fill hell with thee and such of them as shall follow thee, all together!”
ayahs.arabicText: لَأَمْلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنْكَ وَمِمَّنْ تَبِعَكَ مِنْهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

ayahs.englishText: SAY [O Prophet]: “No reward whatever do I ask of you for this [message]; and I am not one of those who claim to be what they are not.
ayahs.arabicText: قُلْ مَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ وَمَا أَنَا مِنَ الْمُتَكَلِّفِينَ

ayahs.englishText: This [divine writ], behold, is no less than a reminder to all the worlds —
ayahs.arabicText: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِلْعَالَمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and you will most certainly grasp its purport after a lapse of time!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَتَعْلَمُنَّ نَبَأَهُ بَعْدَ حِينٍ
